caption: Figure 1: An example of the momentum term u10 in SSGDm when K = 4. The gradients shown in red indicate those having not arrived at the server. In this case, u10 = β² × (ng⁰ + ng⁰ + ng⁰ + ng⁰) + β¹ × (ng₁ + ng₁ + ng₁ + ng₁) + β⁰ × (ng₄ + ng₄).
description: This figure illustrates the momentum term (u10) calculation in the Synchronous SGD with momentum (SSGDm) algorithm when there are 4 workers (K=4).  Each colored block represents a scaled gradient (ηg) from a worker.  Blue blocks represent gradients that have already arrived at the server, while red blocks represent gradients that haven't yet arrived. The equation shows how the momentum is a weighted sum of these gradients, with weights determined by the momentum coefficient (β) and the order of arrival.  The order is crucial because SSGDm uses a synchronous scheduler, meaning all gradients from a given iteration must arrive before the model is updated. Gradients from earlier iterations are weighted less (higher power of β).
